meanings.definition: A device consisting of two flexible strips of metal or plastic with interlocking projections closed or opened by pulling a slide along them.
meanings.sent1: I pulled the zipper on my jacket to keep warm.
meanings.sent2: She zipped up her backpack before heading to school.
meanings.sent3: The zipper on my pencil case decided to take a break today.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a zipper, opening up to reveal his happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the zipper echoed through the quiet room.

meanings.definition: To fasten or unfasten a zipper.
meanings.sent1: Can you help me zipper my dress?
meanings.sent2: He quickly zippers his coat before going outside.
meanings.sent3: I tried to zipper my shoes, but they were too stubborn.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to zipper his heart closed.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a trick where he could zipper and unzipper items with a wave of his hand.

meanings.definition: A fastener consisting of two strips of metal or plastic with interlocking projections.
meanings.sent1: The zipper on the bag broke, and everything fell out.
meanings.sent2: She fixed the broken zipper on her favorite purse.
meanings.sent3: The zipper on his wallet seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a zipper, always connecting them no matter what.
meanings.sent5: The shiny zipper gleamed under the bright lights of the store.
